structure.unit: COUNTIES, CITIES, AND OTHER LOCAL UNITS
GENERAL PROVISIONS APPLICABLE TO COUNTIES, CITIES, AND OTHER LOCAL UNITS

law.catch_line: "Employer", "employee" defined -- Spouse to acknowledge action in writing if not named as beneficiary by employee.

text.section: KRS 344.030 notwithstanding, for the purposes of this section, "employer" shall mean the sponsor of and "employee" shall mean a member of a pension plan governed by the federal "Employee Retirement Income Security Act of 1974," and any member of a state pension plan or a pension plan of any unit of local government.

For any employee who elects not to take a joint and survivor annuity or who selects a beneficiary other than the spouse if living, the employer shall provide forms which provide for the spouse of the employee to acknowledge by signature such action.

law.history: Created 1984 Ky. Acts ch. 239, sec. 1, effective July 13, 1984.
